intro: Calandrinia capitata var. prolifera, commonly known as the clustered bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and profuse flowering. The plant produces small, showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to thrive in arid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
